value.name: RLen
value.description: The computer-generated, five-character numeric string that specifies the length of the entire record. The number is right justified and each unused position contains a zero.

value.name: Base
value.description: The computer-generated, five-character numeric string that indicates the first character position of the first variable control field in a record. The number is right justified and each unused position contains a zero.

value.name: RStat
value.description: Indicates the relation of the record to a file.

option.desc: a A monographic bibliographic unit that is physically attached to or contained in another unit
b A serial bibliographic unit that is physically attached to or contained in another serial unit
c A made-up multipart group of items that were not originally published, distributed, or produced together
d A part of a collection, especially an archival unit described collectively elsewhere in the system.
i A bibliographic resource that is added to or changed by means of updates
m An item either complete in one part (monograph) or intended to be completed in a finite number of separate parts (multivolume monograph).
s An item issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended to be continued indefinitely (e.g., serials, journals, series, newspapers).

value.name: Desc
value.description: Descriptive Cataloging Form: black: non-ISBD, a:AACR2, i:ISBD, u:Unknown

value.name: Undefined
value.description: Each contains a blank (#) or fill character (|)

option.description: One color Does not include black.
Paper Any kind of cellulose-based paper.
Porcelain Used only for clay-based porcelain.
Synthetic Does not include synthetics formed to resemble textiles.
Skin Does not include synthetic materials that resemble skin.
Textile Includes all natural or synthetic fibre fabrics except canvas.
Mixed collection The secondary support material varies for different items in a collection
Paper Any kind of cellulose-based paper.
Plaster Includes mixtures of ground solids and plaster.
Porcelain Used only for clay-based porcelain.
